availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Wormley Sorrell Gibbs (Hancock County high sheriff)

body.p: A Virginia-born, Kentucky farmer and sheriff. Lived in Hancock County in 1860. Married to Mary Wyatt Wroe Gibbs. Father of James Lewin Gibbs and Ophelia Sorrell Gibbs Griffin. Owned five enslaved persons in 1850 and eight in 1860. Served as a justice of the peace in Hancock County in 1847. Served as sheriff of Hancock County in 1858 and 1860. Member of the Masonic Order at Hancock Lodge, No. 115 in Hawesville, Kentucky.

bibl.p: Proceedings of the Grand Lodge of kentucky, at a Grand Annual Communication, in the City of Louisville, Commencing on Monday, the 21st Day of October, 1867 (Frankfort, Ky.: Frankfort Commonwealth, 1867), 111-112; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 94; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 8-9; "Wormley Sorrell Gibbs," (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=67762776&ref=acom) (accessed on April 6, 2017); The Kentucky State Register, for the year 1847 (Louisville: Morton & Griswold, 1847), 93.
